themes: Escalating construction costs impacting art funding
Concerns about proportional spending on art in large projects
Need for financial limits or caps on AIPP allocations
Proposal to redirect some funds to maintenance and smaller projects
Call for a complete overhaul of the AIPP program
key_phrases: watching the drama over the art at the new airport
the amount set aside for AIPP in a new build/construction is based on a % of the total budget
better for the City to say a % of the budget with a not to exceed amount for AIPP
some % goes into 'savings' to help with maintenance, repairs and perhaps purchasing AIPP in other smaller, lower-budgeted projects
with some of these larger projects, you are spending SO MUCH on the art, that you have to scale back in the design or construction of the project
the entire AIPP program needs to be completely overhauled
barriers_identified: Escalating construction costs reducing funds for other project needs
Overspending on art in large projects leading to cutbacks in design or construction
solutions_proposed: Set a not-to-exceed cap on AIPP allocations
Redirect a percentage of AIPP funds into savings for maintenance, repairs, or smaller projects
